intro: Morongia floridana, commonly known as the Florida morongia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Morongia floridana plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
